meanings.definition: A short, sharp sound made by pressing a button or switch.
meanings.sent1: The computer mouse makes a click when you press the button.
meanings.sent2: I heard a click when I turned off the light switch.
meanings.sent3: The click of the door closing behind him startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: The click of the lock echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The click of the camera captured the perfect moment.

meanings.definition: A metric unit of distance equal to 0.621371 miles.
meanings.sent1: The car traveled several clicks before reaching the gas station.
meanings.sent2: The signpost showed the distance in clicks to the next town.
meanings.sent3: She joked that she could run a few clicks faster than him.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner pushed through the last few clicks to the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The map indicated the distance in clicks to the mountain peak.

meanings.definition: A metric unit of frequency equal to one kilohertz.
meanings.sent1: The radio station broadcasts at a frequency of a thousand clicks.
meanings.sent2: The technician adjusted the equipment to receive the signal at 5 clicks.
meanings.sent3: The scientist measured the clicks emitted by the device for the experiment.
meanings.sent4: The radar detected the enemy aircraft at multiple clicks away.
meanings.sent5: The submarine used sonar to detect the clicks of marine life nearby.
